name: HD 30856
scenarioDescription:
The HD 30856 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 30856 is a star with 1.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.4 times its radius. It is located 429.55 light years away from the solar system.

HD 30856 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 30856 system


HD 30856 b

HD 30856 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.85 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 30856 b is 491.94599999999997 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 30856 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 30856, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
